positive.review: Nice game, don't have to purchase cricket 26 now, i will for discount in winter sale , as cricket 24 is almost same as cricket 26, so its my opinion

As a Cricket fan, Cricket 24 is a solid step forward compared to previous Big Ant titles, but it still carries some of the old problems that cricket fans know too well. 

The Good
1. Improved graphics: Player faces, stadium lighting, and animations look noticeably better. Not perfect, but a clear upgrade.
2. Licensing: Having more official teams and leagues really adds to the immersion. Career mode feels more authentic now.
3. Batting feels smoother: Shot timing is more consistent, and playing different strokes feels satisfying, especially when timing a cover drive perfectly.
4. Atmosphere & presentation: Crowd noise, commentary, and stadium ambience genuinely improve the match experience.

The Not-So-Good
1. Bugs & glitches: Classic Big Ant issues. Weird fielding animations, sudden drops in frame rate, and players teleporting/overthrowing for no reason.
2. Fielding AI: Still the weakest part. Fielders react late or throw to the wrong end at crucial moments.
3. Career mode lacks depth: Fun at first, but progression feels slow and repetitive.
4. UI feels outdated: Menus and navigation could be much more modern and intuitive.

Overall Cricket 24 is enjoyable for fans who love cricket games, and it definitely has its moments. But it still needs patches and improvements for the experience to feel polished. If you‚Äôre already invested in Big Ant games, you‚Äôll appreciate the upgrades. If you‚Äôre new, expect fun gameplay mixed with some¬†frustration.
Excited For Cricket 26 hope its Optimised and has Better UI, Graphics, improved AI, and Game Mechanism.
Feels like BCCI produced it and PCB tested it. Still would play again.
Very good game .. nice experience.. need to update career mode more
Cricket 24 after all updates and fix is quite a good game...

Cricket 24 delivers a fun, content-rich cricket experience with improved gameplay and strong licensing.
However, bugs, inconsistent AI, and dated visuals keep it from reaching its full potential.

Cricket 24 on PC delivers an authentic and enjoyable cricketing experience, blending realism with accessibility for fans of the sport. It‚Äôs a solid step forward for Big Ant Studios, offering refined gameplay mechanics, expanded licensing, and immersive stadium atmospheres that make every match feel alive.
Even with all the glitches it has a feel good factor attached to it, hopefully Cricket 26 addresses the issues in cricket 24 and turns out to be a great worthwhile addition.

Cricket 24 is definitely a solid step forward for cricket gaming fans. The visuals, updated player rosters, and new tournaments make it feel more complete and immersive compared to previous titles. The batting and bowling mechanics feel smoother, and the atmosphere of real stadiums adds a nice touch to the experience.

However, the game still needs some polishing. There are a few noticeable glitches ‚Äî especially with back-foot shots, which don‚Äôt always connect or animate properly. Some AI behaviors can also feel inconsistent at times. A few patches could easily fix these small issues and make the gameplay feel more realistic.

Overall, Cricket 24 is a good game with great potential ‚Äî fun to play, especially for cricket lovers, but it still needs a few updates to iron out the glitches and improve shot timing and animations. Once fixed, it could easily be the best cricket game out there

negative.review:
If you love cricket you will be tempted to play this game and honestly as a functional, faithful representation of cricket there is a bit to love about it.

The gameplay is fun at first and for a while I was pretty engaged by the career mode where I set a goal of scoring an international century and taking a five-wicket bag in career mode.

The reason I've ultimately said that I wouldn't recommend this game is because it is just so repetitive and there is very little true sense of progress as you step up through the ranks beyond wearing slightly different uniforms. For me it mostly just came to working out two or three shots that always worked and hitting them over and over again through club, state & ultimately international level. Ultimately the experience just left me feeling kind of empty by the end as it required very little beyond the initial learning curve and no real problem solving once that way of 'winning' was worked out.

If you are a cricket fan you may enjoy this for a time as it is a functional game that works and doesn't have too many bugs but I wouldn't call it a good game, much less a great one.
before playing this game i was very curious that it is too awesome but there has been some kind of lags, issues, duplicates unsung players as well as full of fake and un ordered things

Cricket 24 is programmed for partiality whenever playing online games,those who purchase the team will get all benefit like always get the wide ball even if ball is of good length
1. opponent bowler will always get wide even in good length ball
2. good timing batting in practise game will show early in timing graph of online game

Application is not working, irrespective of complaining no action made from the team, we feel no meaning in  buying this game not able to use. either support to fix the issue and arrange for the refund.

Game is broken, most of the times slip fielder takes catch yet the batsman not given out, career is taking ages to move the player to national or state level despite avg of 50+, fielders do overthrows

Not a suitable upgrade to the Cricket 19. the gameplay, graphics, interactions, you mention anything, cricket 19 is does it better in them. Had to purchase this only to get online players as cricket 19 online players were not available anymore. Better to skip this.

There are a lot of bugs in this game. Please fix them.

- The fielder runs to collect the ball, but it still goes for four.
- The ball gets edged, but it travels in an unrealistic direction.

üéÆ Cricket 24 (PC) ‚Äì 375 Hours Later‚Ä¶ üèè

I‚Äôve sunk 375 hours into this game since launch. That should tell you two things:
1Ô∏è‚É£ I‚Äôm a massive cricket fan.
2Ô∏è‚É£ I‚Äôve given this game way more chances than it deserves.

‚ú® The Good:

When it works, batting and bowling can actually feel pretty great.

Stadiums and crowd atmosphere give a nice vibe.

Career mode has the right idea but not the polish.

üíÄ The Ugly:

üêû Bugs everywhere: fielders teleporting, bizarre AI decisions, broken animations.

üé¢ Performance is all over the place‚ÄîFPS drops, stuttering, random crashes.

üåê Online? Forget it. Desyncs, lag, and rage quitters make it unbearable.

üì¢ Commentary feels like a broken record on repeat since the last few titles.

üí§ Updates are slow and barely scratch the surface of major issues.

‚öñÔ∏è Verdict:
After 375 hours, I can say this: Cricket 24 isn‚Äôt the ‚Äúnext gen cricket experience‚Äù it was marketed as. It‚Äôs more like Cricket 22.5 with extra bugs and a shinier menu. Hardcore fans might squeeze out some fun I clearly did, but for most players this game will test your patience more than your cricketing skills.

‚≠ê 5/10 ‚Äì Only buy if you‚Äôre desperate for cricket on PC.

The downfall of Cricket games under Bigant has been sad to see. A game with such substance has been watered down to just a bunch of shallow features like licensing and fancy designs of jerseys. They took away the gameplay mechanics that made Bigant cricket games fun. The same game has been copy pasted since Cricket 19 and even in that a bunch of good mechanics have been taken away for no reason. Such a shame.

If you love cricket you will be tempted to play this game and honestly as a functional, faithful representation of cricket there is a bit to love about it.

The gameplay is fun at first and for a while I was pretty engaged by the career mode where I set a goal of scoring an international century and taking a five-wicket bag in career mode.

The reason I've ultimately said that I wouldn't recommend this game is because it is just so repetitive and there is very little true sense of progress as you step up through the ranks beyond wearing slightly different uniforms. For me it mostly just came to working out two or three shots that always worked and hitting them over and over again through club, state & ultimately international level. Ultimately the experience just left me feeling kind of empty by the end as it required very little beyond the initial learning curve and no real problem solving once that way of 'winning' was worked out.

If you are a cricket fan you may enjoy this for a time as it is a functional game that works and doesn't have too many bugs but I wouldn't call it a good game, much less a great one.

The game has potential, but it‚Äôs difficult to recommend in its current state. The developers haven‚Äôt shown meaningful progress in improving the series, and core issues remain largely unchanged for years. Without significant updates or innovation, it doesn‚Äôt justify the investment

üéÆ Cricket 24 ‚Äì A Massive Letdown (Especially Online)

‚≠ê Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

As someone who genuinely loves cricket and was excited for a modern cricket game, Cricket 24 is a huge disappointment ‚Äî especially in online mode. Here's why:

‚ö†Ô∏è 1. Online Mode Is Completely Broken

Opponents can smash sixes every single ball ‚Äî no matter what delivery you bowl. Change of pace, line, length ‚Äî nothing works.

When you bat? Even perfectly timed shots result in mishits. Boundaries feel impossible unless the game randomly decides to let you score.

The entire online experience feels rigged and unbalanced, like you‚Äôre playing two different versions of the game depending on which end you‚Äôre on.

üêû 2. Game is Full of Bugs (And They‚Äôre Not Minor)

Fielders just stand near the ball without picking it up. The opposition runs 4‚Äì5 runs before your fielder even reacts.

Stumpings and runouts? A joke. Wicketkeepers throw at invisible stumps or take ages to react while the batter casually gets back in.

Basic gameplay mechanics feel unpolished and unfinished, even after updates.

ü§∑‚ôÇÔ∏è 3. Devs Show Little Interest in Fixing Core Issues

These aren't new bugs. Players have been reporting the same problems since launch ‚Äî and still, no meaningful fixes.

Instead of fixing gameplay, we get cosmetic updates or licensing additions no one asked for.

üéØ Final Verdict:

If you're looking for a fair, competitive cricket game ‚Äî look elsewhere. Offline mode is passable, but online is frustrating, unbalanced, and full of game-breaking bugs.
It feels like the developers rushed this out the door and never cared enough to polish it.

Cricket fans deserve better. This ain‚Äôt it.

The game has potential, but it‚Äôs difficult to recommend in its current state. The developers haven‚Äôt shown meaningful progress in improving the series, and core issues remain largely unchanged for years. Without significant updates or innovation, it doesn‚Äôt justify the investment

üéÆ Cricket 24 ‚Äì A Massive Letdown (Especially Online)

‚≠ê Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

As someone who genuinely loves cricket and was excited for a modern cricket game, Cricket 24 is a huge disappointment ‚Äî especially in online mode. Here's why:

‚ö†Ô∏è 1. Online Mode Is Completely Broken

Opponents can smash sixes every single ball ‚Äî no matter what delivery you bowl. Change of pace, line, length ‚Äî nothing works.

When you bat? Even perfectly timed shots result in mishits. Boundaries feel impossible unless the game randomly decides to let you score.

The entire online experience feels rigged and unbalanced, like you‚Äôre playing two different versions of the game depending on which end you‚Äôre on.

üêû 2. Game is Full of Bugs (And They‚Äôre Not Minor)

Fielders just stand near the ball without picking it up. The opposition runs 4‚Äì5 runs before your fielder even reacts.

Stumpings and runouts? A joke. Wicketkeepers throw at invisible stumps or take ages to react while the batter casually gets back in.

Basic gameplay mechanics feel unpolished and unfinished, even after updates.

ü§∑‚ôÇÔ∏è 3. Devs Show Little Interest in Fixing Core Issues

These aren't new bugs. Players have been reporting the same problems since launch ‚Äî and still, no meaningful fixes.

Instead of fixing gameplay, we get cosmetic updates or licensing additions no one asked for.

üéØ Final Verdict:

If you're looking for a fair, competitive cricket game ‚Äî look elsewhere. Offline mode is passable, but online is frustrating, unbalanced, and full of game-breaking bugs.
It feels like the developers rushed this out the door and never cared enough to polish it.

Cricket fans deserve better. This ain‚Äôt it.

üéÆ Cricket 24 (PC) ‚Äì 375 Hours Later‚Ä¶ üèè

I‚Äôve sunk 375 hours into this game since launch. That should tell you two things:
1Ô∏è‚É£ I‚Äôm a massive cricket fan.
2Ô∏è‚É£ I‚Äôve given this game way more chances than it deserves.

‚ú® The Good:

When it works, batting and bowling can actually feel pretty great.

Stadiums and crowd atmosphere give a nice vibe.

Career mode has the right idea but not the polish.

üíÄ The Ugly:

üêû Bugs everywhere: fielders teleporting, bizarre AI decisions, broken animations.

üé¢ Performance is all over the place‚ÄîFPS drops, stuttering, random crashes.

üåê Online? Forget it. Desyncs, lag, and rage quitters make it unbearable.

üì¢ Commentary feels like a broken record on repeat since the last few titles.

üí§ Updates are slow and barely scratch the surface of major issues.

‚öñÔ∏è Verdict:
After 375 hours, I can say this: Cricket 24 isn‚Äôt the ‚Äúnext gen cricket experience‚Äù it was marketed as. It‚Äôs more like Cricket 22.5 with extra bugs and a shinier menu. Hardcore fans might squeeze out some fun I clearly did, but for most players this game will test your patience more than your cricketing skills.

‚≠ê 5/10 ‚Äì Only buy if you‚Äôre desperate for cricket on PC.

The downfall of Cricket games under Bigant has been sad to see. A game with such substance has been watered down to just a bunch of shallow features like licensing and fancy designs of jerseys. They took away the gameplay mechanics that made Bigant cricket games fun. The same game has been copy pasted since Cricket 19 and even in that a bunch of good mechanics have been taken away for no reason. Such a shame.

If you love cricket you will be tempted to play this game and honestly as a functional, faithful representation of cricket there is a bit to love about it.

The gameplay is fun at first and for a while I was pretty engaged by the career mode where I set a goal of scoring an international century and taking a five-wicket bag in career mode.

The reason I've ultimately said that I wouldn't recommend this game is because it is just so repetitive and there is very little true sense of progress as you step up through the ranks beyond wearing slightly different uniforms. For me it mostly just came to working out two or three shots that always worked and hitting them over and over again through club, state & ultimately international level. Ultimately the experience just left me feeling kind of empty by the end as it required very little beyond the initial learning curve and no real problem solving once that way of 'winning' was worked out.

If you are a cricket fan you may enjoy this for a time as it is a functional game that works and doesn't have too many bugs but I wouldn't call it a good game, much less a great one.
